sections.1_story_intuition: Important days and dates are frequently asked in competitive exams. Remembering national and international observances, their significance, and related facts helps in scoring well in the GK section. This section covers key days, their themes, and exam-relevant facts.
2_key_definitions: National Day: A day of significance for a country.
International Day: A day observed worldwide for a cause.
Anniversary: Annual recurrence of a date marking an event.
Observance: The act of celebrating or honoring a day.
Theme: Central idea for a particular year's observance.
UN Day: Day observed by the United Nations.
Holiday: A day of rest or celebration.
Commemoration: Honoring the memory of an event or person.
Festival: A day of religious or cultural celebration.
Awareness Day: A day to spread knowledge about an issue.
5_exam_capsules: When is Republic Day celebrated? 26th January.
When is Independence Day celebrated? 15th August.
When is World Environment Day? 5th June.
When is World Health Day? 7th April.
When is International Women's Day? 8th March.
When is World AIDS Day? 1st December.
When is World Population Day? 11th July.
When is National Science Day? 28th February.
When is World Water Day? 22nd March.
When is International Yoga Day? 21st June.
When is World Literacy Day? 8th September.
When is World Food Day? 16th October.
7_traps_confusing_points: Confusing Republic Day (26 Jan) with Independence Day (15 Aug).
Mixing up dates of World Environment Day and World Health Day.
Assuming Children's Day is on 1st June (it's 14th Nov in India).
Confusing Teacher's Day (India: 5 Sep, World: 5 Oct).
Mixing up Gandhi Jayanti and Lal Bahadur Shastri Jayanti (both 2 Oct).
Assuming all international days are UN days.
Confusing World AIDS Day (1 Dec) with World Health Day (7 Apr).
Mixing up National Science Day and National Technology Day.
Assuming all countries celebrate the same days.
Confusing World Literacy Day (8 Sep) with World Population Day (11 Jul).

8_case_study_context.title: World Environment Day
8_case_study_context.explanation: World Environment Day, celebrated on 5th June, raises awareness about environmental protection. Each year has a theme, such as 'Beat Plastic Pollution', to focus global attention on urgent environmental issues.
